The next closest apple is at (2,0), but moving directly towards it might not be the best strategy considering the position of snake #1 at (6,8) and the apple at (8,8). Snake #1 could potentially move towards the apple at (8,8), and I should aim to secure as many apples as possible while avoiding direct confrontation.

Given the current positions, moving left or right doesn't seem beneficial as it would not lead me closer to any apples and might put me in a vulnerable position. Moving up would put me in direct path of snake #1, which is not ideal. The best move would be to move down, which would position me closer to the apple at (7,4) and also allow me to monitor the movements of snake #1.

However, upon reevaluation, moving down would put me at (5,5), which is not closer to any apple and might limit my options for the next move. Moving right would put me at (6,6), which is closer to the apple at (7,4) and also keeps me away from snake #1's potential path towards the apple at (8,8).

Strategy for next turn: After moving right, I will reassess the board to see if I can safely move towards the apple at (7,4) while keeping an eye on snake #1's movements.

Next move: RIGHT
